articles: Middlesbrough youngster Lewis Wing may soon have Yannick Bolasie breathing down his neck for a first team place but he turned in a full debut to remember at the Riverside. The 23-year-old local lad, playing non-league in football's ninth tier at nearby Shildon just 18 months ago, set up two goals inside the opening 18 minutes of his first ever start for Boro. But despite the impressive win for Tony Pulis's outfit, the veteran boss faces a frantic few hours before the transfer window closes on Thursday as he tries to strengthen his squad.  Middlesbrough (4-3-3): Randolph, Shotton, Flint, Fry, Friend, Clayton, Howson (McNair 71), Wing (Leadbitter 82), Downing, Braithwaite, Assombalonga (Fletcher 78). Subs not used: Chapman, Johnson, Konstantopoulos, Tavernier. Goals: Braithwaite 7, Flint 18, Downing 25 Manager: Tony Pulis Sheffield United XI (4-5-1): Henderson, Baldock, Stevens, Fleck, O'Connell, Basham, Lundstram (Woodburn 46), Evans, Clarke, Egan, McGoldrick (Duffy 69). Subs not used: Bryan, Leonard, Moore, Sharp, Stearman. Bookings: Clarke, Basham, Evans Manager: Chris Wilder  Referee: Robert Jones Attendance: 22,960 Pulis said: 'Everybody knows we have to bring players in but we want to bring good players in, that's the important thing. 'There has been a case at this club, not just once, that people have come in and spent a hell of a lot of money on players and not really improved it. I'd rather be selective.' The £15 million-rated Everton flyer Bolasie is just one of his targets but Wing certainly rose to that potential challenge on Tuesday night. Pulis's side had the game seemingly wrapped up inside 25 blistering minutes, thanks in large part to Wing. Just seven minutes had gone when Wing's left-flank corner was flicked on by Dale Fry and Martin Braithwaite's reactions were quicker than United's defence with the Danish forward stabbing in from six yards. Sheffield failed to learn from that warning and, after John Egan deflected Ryan Shotton's cross behind for a corner, they conceded in almost identical circumstances. Wing again provided the delivery, sending over an inviting centre which saw Aden Flint lose his marker Egan and head in number two. It was also a key indication of why Pulis was so keen to pay Bristol City £7million for Flint's services this summer after the free-scoring central defender hit the net an astonishing 35 times for them over the past four seasons. It was turning into an impressive statement by Pulis's side and was about to become even more so with a third goal, this one from former England winger Stewart Downing.  Full-back Shotton was the architect as he floated over a right-wing cross which hit Downing's outstretched leg, sending an awkward bouncing ball over the head of keeper Dean Henderson.  It was a blistering start to Boro's home campaign and if Braithwaite's low shot had not been deflected inches wide of United's left-hand post on the stroke of half-time, a fully-fledged rout would have been in the offing. But, after losing high-profile stars Ben Gibson, Patrick Bamford and Adama Traore in recent days, Pulis would have been delighted by the response of his stars - and youngsters Fry and Wing in particular. A Downing shot again threaten the visitors' goal soon after the restart and Sheffield's frustrations were beginning to show by the time Chris Basham was booked for a brutal late foul on Braithwaite. And when Leon Clarke wasted their first chance of the tie, heading over a far-post cross from sub Ben Woodburn, it was clearly not to be the Blades' night. Wing's deadly corner routines almost produced more success as his cross again found the dangerous Flint who this time headed just wide. But as Boro were happy to see out the contest and coast towards their first win of the season, United began to finally create some openings, even if their finishing was as wayward as their defending had been at the start of the game. Lee Evans blasted high and wide from John Fleck, before falling over as he lined up to shoot from another attack. In the 76th minute, Clarke was handed another chance to at least get Sheffield on the scoreboard when clean through on goal only to be denied by Darren Randolph's reflex stop.

Randolph, Shotton, Flint, Fry, Friend, Clayton, Howson (McNair 71), Wing (Leadbitter 82), Downing, Braithwaite, Assombalonga (Fletcher 78).', 'Subs not used: Chapman, Johnson, Konstantopoulos, Tavernier.', "Goals:\xa0Braithwaite 7, Flint 18, Downing 25 Manager: Tony Pulis Sheffield United XI (4-5-1):\xa0Henderson, Baldock, Stevens, Fleck, O'Connell, Basham, Lundstram (Woodburn 46), Evans, Clarke, Egan, McGoldrick (Duffy 69).", 'Subs not used: Bryan, Leonard, Moore, Sharp, Stearman.', "Bookings:\xa0Clarke, Basham, Evans Manager:\xa0Chris Wilder\xa0 Referee:\xa0Robert Jones Attendance: 22,960 Pulis said: 'Everybody knows we have to bring players in but we want to bring good players in, that's the important thing.", "'There has been a case at this club, not just once, that people have come in and spent a hell of a lot of money on players and not really improved it.", "I'd rather be selective.'", 'The £15 million-rated Everton flyer Bolasie is just one of his targets but Wing certainly rose to that potential challenge on Tuesday night.', "Pulis's side had the game seemingly wrapped up inside 25 blistering minutes, thanks in large part to Wing.", "Just seven minutes had gone when Wing's left-flank corner was flicked on by Dale Fry and Martin Braithwaite's reactions were quicker than United's defence with the Danish forward stabbing in from six yards.", "Sheffield failed to learn from that warning and, after John Egan deflected Ryan Shotton's cross behind for a corner, they conceded in almost identical circumstances.", 'Wing again provided the delivery, sending over an inviting centre which saw Aden Flint lose his marker Egan and head in number two.', "It was also a key indication of why Pulis was so keen to pay Bristol City £7million for Flint's services this summer after the free-scoring central defender hit the net an astonishing 35 times for them over the past four seasons.", "It was turning into an impressive statement by Pulis's side and was about to become even more so with a third goal, this one from former England winger Stewart Downing.", "Full-back Shotton was the architect as he floated over a right-wing cross which hit Downing's outstretched leg, sending an awkward bouncing ball over the head of keeper Dean Henderson.", "It was a blistering start to Boro's home campaign and if Braithwaite's low shot had not been deflected inches wide of United's left-hand post on the stroke of half-time, a fully-fledged rout would have been in the offing.", 'But, after losing high-profile stars Ben Gibson, Patrick Bamford and Adama Traore in recent days, Pulis would have been delighted by the response of his stars - and youngsters Fry and Wing in particular.', "A Downing shot again threaten the visitors' goal soon after the restart and Sheffield's frustrations were beginning to show by the time Chris Basham was booked for a brutal late foul on Braithwaite.", "And when Leon Clarke wasted their first chance of the tie, heading over a far-post cross from sub Ben Woodburn, it was clearly not to be the Blades' night.", "Wing's deadly corner routines almost produced more success as his cross again found the dangerous Flint who this time headed just wide.", 'But as Boro were happy to see out the contest and coast towards their first win of the season, United began to finally create some openings, even if their finishing was as wayward as their defending had been at the start of the game.', 'Lee Evans blasted high and wide from John Fleck, before falling over as he lined up to shoot from another attack.', "In the 76th minute, Clarke was handed another chance to at least get Sheffield on the scoreboard when clean through on goal only to be denied by Darren Randolph's reflex stop."]

articles: Chelsea's first trip to the new White Hart Lane to face Tottenham Hotspur is among the highlights across the fixtures picked by Sky and BT for October and November's matches. BT Sport will host the London derby at the officially named Tottenham Hostpur Stadium, with kick-off at 5.30pm on Saturday, November 24. Elsewhere, Manchester City's home clash with Manchester United will be shown on Sky Sports. The latest TV picks once again sees just one round of Friday Night Football and that comes on October 5 as Brighton take on West Ham at the AMEX Stadium at 8pm on Sky Sports.  The champions will welcome Jose Mourinho's men to the Etihad Stadium on Sunday November 11 at 4.30pm on an afternoon where Chelsea face Everton and Liverpool take on Fulham. Pep Guardiola's side will be out for revenge after in April they blew a 2-0 lead over Manchester United to lose, thus missing out on claiming the Premier League title with a win over their city rivals. Friday, October 5 Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United (Sky Sports) 8pm Saturday, October 6 Manchester United v Newcastle United (BT Sport) 5.30pm Sunday, October 7 Fulham v Arsenal (BT Sport) Midday Southampton v Chelsea (Sky Sports) 2.15pm Liverpool v Manchester City (Sky Sports) 4.30pm Saturday, October 20 Chelsea v Manchester United (Sky Sports) 12.30pm Huddersfield Town v Liverpool (BT Sport) 5.30pm Sunday, October 21 Everton v Crystal Palace (Sky Sports) 4pm Monday, October 22 Arsenal v Leicester City (Sky Sports) 8pm Saturday, October 27 Manchester United v Everton (Sky Sports) 12.30pm Leicester City v West Ham United (BT Sport) 5.30pm Sunday, October 28 Crystal Palace v Arsenal (Sky Sports) 1.30pm Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester City (Sky Sports) 4pm Saturday, November 3 Bournemouth v Manchester United (BT Sport) 12.30pm Arsenal v Liverpool (BT Sport) 5.30pm Sunday, November 4 Wolverhampton Wanderers v Tottenham Hotspur (Sky Sports) 1.30pm* * Should Spurs be involved in the UEFA Champions League the next Tuesday, this match will move to Saturday November 3, at 7.45pm Chelsea v Crystal Palace (Sky Sports) 4pm Monday, November 5 Huddersfield Town v Fulham (Sky Sports) 8pm Saturday November 10 Cardiff City v Brighton & Hove Albion (Sky Sports) 12.30pm Crystal Palace v Tottenham Hotspur (BT Sport) 5.30pm Sunday, November 11 Liverpool v Fulham (BT Sport) Midday Chelsea v Everton (Sky Sports) 2.15pm Manchester City v Manchester United (Sky Sports) 4.30pm Saturday, November 24  Tottenham Hotspur v Chelsea (BT Sport) 5.30pm Sunday, November 25 Bournemouth v Arsenal (Sky Sports) 1.30pm Wolverhampton Wanderers v Huddersfield Town (Sky Sports) 4pm Monday, November 26 Burnley v Newcastle (Sky Sports) 8pm   That is then followed by Manchester United taking on Newcastle United in the evening a day later on BT Sport in Saturday's only televised match. The first weekend of the latest release of TV fixtures sees Liverpool and Manchester City clash at Anfield at 4.30pm having followed Fulham vs Arsenal on BT as well as Chelsea and Southampton on Sky. Other notable clashes in October include Chelsea taking on Manchester United on the 20th as Jose Mourinho makes a return to his former side in the 12.30pm clash on Sky.  Rounding off the month, City are again on the box as they make their first visit to the new White Hart Lane on the 28th as they take on Tottenham Hotspur to wrap up the month on Sky's Super Sunday. November then starts with a bang on BT as after United visit Bournemouth, Arsenal host Liverpool at 5.30pm to help conclude Saturday's drama.  There are just three Monday night games across the period, with the first seeing Arsenal take on Leicester City on October 22. Huddersfield Town then host Fulham a fortnight later before Burnley and Newcastle United wrap up the latest round of TV fixtures on November 26.

articles: If not for Zinedine Zidane, Chelsea’s incoming new keeper Kepa Arrizabalaga would be playing for Real Madrid next season. Meanwhile Thibaut Courtois would probably have signed a new contract at Stamford Bridge. Here, Sportsmail looks at the 21-year-old Spain international. Kepa was lined up by Real Madrid in the winter transfer window but Zidane made a stand and blocked the signing.  It’s almost unheard of for Real Madrid coaches to veto transfers and when Zidane clashed again with the club at the end of the season over other players it was the signal for a parting of the ways. No, he just didn’t want his squad upset mid-season. He wanted his keepers protected.  Keylor Navas would end up repaying his faith by starring in Madrid’s journey to another Champions League final. And Zidane’s son Lucas made his debut in goal in the club’s last match of the season. And a five-year deal for around £120,000 a week. He still had the option of joining Madrid this summer on a free transfer with an 8million euros signing on fee because he was almost out of contract.  But Athletic threatened to leave him in the stands if he left for free. Thinking of how that would destroy his chances of making Spain’s World Cup squad he caved in and signed a new five-year deal with Athletic that included an 80m euro release clause – activated by Chelsea on Tuesday. He was impressive on his debut in a friendly against Costa Rica before the tournament and he went to Russia as David De Gea’s understudy.  He is highly thought of by current Real Madrid coach and then Spain boss Julen Lopetegui and there were even calls for Kepa to step in for De Gea after he blundered early in the tournament. Born in the fishing town of Ondarroa in the Bay of Biscay, he joined Athletic when he was 10-years-old. He played at every age group for the club, went out on loan to second division sides Ponferradina and Valladolid, and was then named as third keeper for the first team by Marcelo Bielsa in 2012.  It was current Barcelona coach Ernesto Valverde who gradually made him first choice so there are plenty of big-name coaches who have trusted him. No he needs to improve in the air but as he fills out and gains in confidence that is probably inevitable. He has also tried to dribble out from the back before for Spain Under 21s against Croatia and been caught out.  And he made bad mistakes against Valencia early in the season, coming off of his line at the wrong time, but he recovered well in the following games, showing great mental strength. Maurizio Sarri is a fan and even suggested him to Napoli. He won’t discourage that confidence to come out and offer himself to his defenders. His most impressive calling card is that list of clubs interested in taking him.  As well as Real Madrid looking at him last season, Atletico Madrid had him down as their No 1 option should they lose Jan Oblak. Arsenal also took a look in the middle of last season.  There is huge desire to improve. He is coming to make the Chelsea fans forget about Courtois and also to wrestle the Spain starting berth from De Gea. Yes he came close and he believes playing for Sarri in the most competitive league in the world will take him one step further, make new coach Luis Enrique want him as his No 1, and make former Spain coach Lopetegui regret the way Real Madrid ever let Zidane block the signing last January. Everyone in Spain called him Kepa. Maybe just amend the old Azpilicueta song: Arrizabalaga, we just call him Kepa.

articles: Calum Chambers said he was 'really excited' to join Fulham after arriving on a season-long loan deal from Arsenal. The 23-year-old leaves the Gunners to join the newly-promoted Premier League side where he could link up in central defence with former England Under-21 team-mate Alfie Mawson. Chambers told the club's website: 'I watched a lot of Fulham last season, I really like the way they play football, there's a good manager, it's a great club, so I'm really excited for the season ahead. 'Everyone can see that Fulham's a club that likes to play football, play football from the back, through the lines. That's the style of football I like as well, so I think it fits me and suits the way I play.' Fulham, managed by Slavisa Jokanovic, have been active in the transfer market since they secured a Premier League return via the play-offs, bringing in Mawson from Swansea plus Jean Michael Seri, Maxime Le Marchand, Fabri and Andre Schurrle. Mawson and Chambers paired up for England at the European Under 21 Championships in 2017, while the move to Craven Cottage could also re-ignite a senior England career for Chambers. Chambers won three England caps in the space of two months in 2014 but has been out of the international picture during Gareth Southgate's time as manager. Southgate knows all about Chambers, however, from his time as England Under 21 boss. Fulham director of football operations Tony Khan added: 'Calum is a versatile defender with Premier League experience, and the combination of his strong data profile and the positive reports from our scouting department confirm that he's a tremendous talent.'

articles: Bournemouth have finally captured Colombia central midfielder Jefferson Lerma from Levante on a five-year deal for a club record fee of £25million, the Premier League team announced on Tuesday. The 23-year-old, whose transfer is subject to international clearance, played in all of Colombia's games at this year's World Cup in Russia, including the last 16 loss to England. The transfer fee for Lerma beats the previous record of £20m the club paid for Dutch defender Nathan Ake from Chelsea last year. 'The transfer has been very long because it took a while for the clubs to reach an agreement, but the most important thing is that I am here now and everyone got what they wanted in the end,' Lerma told the club website. 'I have always loved the Premier League style of football and am very happy to have this opportunity. I am looking forward to success and doing important things for this club.' Lerma started out with Colombian side Atletico Huila and joined Spanish Liga club Levante in 2015, initially on loan, playing 93 games in all competitions and scoring three goals. He made his Colombia debut in November 2017, featuring nine times so far, and played at the 2016 Olympics. 'Jefferson is an extremely talented player and a very good athlete who will bring a different type of play to our midfield,' said Cherries manager Eddie Howe. He is the club's third close-season signing after Sheffield United midfielder David Brooks and Leganes full-back Diego Rico. Bournemouth chief executive Neill Blake added: 'It hasn't been easy and we have had to be patient, but we have got our man and it is a huge statement for this club. 'A new record transfer speaks volumes of the ambition of our owners to continue progressing the club and competing in the Premier League.'

articles: Lyon manager Bruno Genesio has refused to rule out the sale of Nabil Fekir before Thursday's transfer deadline for English clubs. The in-demand forward came close to joining Liverpool earlier this summer only for talks to hit a snag at the eleventh hour, while Chelsea have also expressed an interest in his signature. But with a few days left of before the  window slams shut, Genesio has admitted that Fekir's future is still up in the air - and that the France international requested a transfer at the end of the season. 'It's too early to say,' he told reporters after Lyon's International Champions Cup defeat to Chelsea on Tuesday. 'He wanted to leave at the end of last season, but came back to training yesterday and was happy. 'Who knows? There may be opportunities that come up before the end of the window. For now, he is a Lyon player.'  Fekir was not involved in Lyon's penalty shootout loss to Chelsea at Stamford Bridge on Tuesday. He only returned to Lyon training on Monday after enjoying an extended break following France's World Cup win. In his absence, the Ligue 1 side toiled for inspiration, with former England stopper Rob Green saving the decisive penalty following a goalless 90 minutes. Eden Hazard then scored the winner from 12 yards as Chelsea ended their pre-season on a high. Lyon now face an anxious wait to see if either Premier League side mounts a late bid for Fekir, who scored 18 goals in just 28 Ligue 1 starts last season. Liverpool strengthened their attacking options with the £13m signing of Xherdan Shaqiri following the collapse of the Fekir deal. Chelsea, meanwhile, have made a loan offer for Real Madrid midfielder Mateo Kovacic. The Stamford Bridge club have also agreed a world-record £72m fee with Athletic Bilbao for goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga as they seek to find a replacement for Thibaut Courtois.

articles: Barcelona will only be able to move for Paul Pogba this summer if they sell Arsenal target Ousmane Dembele. The Catalan club missed out on Antoine Griezmann in the summer because they could not match the wages being offered to him by Atletico Madrid. They then balked at Chelsea's £70million asking price for Willian and opted instead for Bordeaux winger Malcom at less than half the price. They are not in a financially strong enough position to pay Manchester United's likely asking price for their 25-year-old France World Cup winner. But if they were to find a buyer for Dembele they could look at ways of bringing Pogba to the Nou Camp. Barcelona president Josep Maria Bartomeu has made personal contact with Dembele after he was knocked sideways by the club's decision to sign Malcom – another youngster who plays in the exactly the same position on the wing. Bartomeu has given Dembele assurances that he will not be sold and the former Borussia Dortmund winger was back in training on Monday ahead of schedule. But Barca coach Ernesto Valverde is not overly enamoured with Dembele and if the club had the opportunity to get their money back they would consider the move. They paid £96m for the French international and will pay out a further £40m if he plays enough matches to activate all the add-ons on the deal. Appearances: 27 Goals: 6  Assists: 10 Chances created: 35  Pass accuracy: 85 per cent  *Premier League statistics only  Appearances: 13  Goals: 1  Assists: 5 Chances created: 20  Pass accuracy: 82 per cent  *La Liga statistics only  Arsenal boss Unai Emery would love to add Dembele to his squad of attacking players and the 21-year-old is good friends with former Dortmund players Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and Henrikh Mkhitaryan, as well as compatriot Alexandre Lacazette. Arsenal could make an offer to loan Dembele with a compulsory buy option if Emery can persuade the club to commit to breaking their transfer record. Manchester United have also been linked with Dembele as a replacement for wantaway Anthony Martial, although there would be some reluctance over taking someone who failed to make an impression with Barcelona last season. The sale of Dembele would allow Barcelona's sporting director Eric Abidal to pursue Pogba but if there are no departures this summer then any bid would be postponed until next summer when the club will want to make their mark in the transfer market to counter an expected bid of over £180m from Real Madrid for Neymar. Barca are also wary of the possibility that Pogba's availability is being pushed to help his demands for an improved contract at Old Trafford. For that reason, among others, Real Madrid have so far stayed out of the Pogba situation. The club's president Florentino Perez has always shied away from taking players from Mino Raiola. When they signed James Rodriguez in 2014, Raiola said: 'Madrid is a club that buys a player just because he plays six games well in the World Cup.' He was also quoted in L'Equipe as saying: 'Madrid buy players the way some people buy bath towels and then throw aside. We are not interested in a club like that.' While Perez remains Real Madrid president, business with the Spanish giants is difficult. That leaves the field clear for Barcelona, but they simply do not have the funds to match Manchester United unless they sell Dembele.

Dortmund winger was back in training on Monday ahead of schedule.', 'But Barca coach Ernesto Valverde is not overly enamoured with Dembele and if the club had the opportunity to get their money back they would consider the move.', 'They paid £96m for the French international and will pay out a further £40m if he plays enough matches to activate all the add-ons on the deal.', 'Appearances: 27 Goals: 6\xa0 Assists: 10 Chances created: 35\xa0 Pass accuracy: 85 per cent\xa0 *Premier League statistics only\xa0 Appearances: 13\xa0 Goals: 1\xa0 Assists: 5 Chances created: 20\xa0 Pass accuracy: 82 per cent\xa0 *La Liga statistics only\xa0 Arsenal boss Unai Emery would love to add Dembele to his squad of attacking players and the 21-year-old is good friends with former Dortmund players Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and Henrikh Mkhitaryan, as well as compatriot Alexandre Lacazette.', 'Arsenal could make an offer to loan Dembele with a compulsory buy option if Emery can persuade the club to commit to breaking their transfer record.', 'Manchester United have also been linked with Dembele as a replacement for wantaway Anthony Martial, although there would be some reluctance over taking someone who failed to make an impression with Barcelona last season.', "The sale of Dembele would allow Barcelona's sporting director Eric Abidal to pursue Pogba but if there are no departures this summer then any bid would be postponed until next summer when the club will want to make their mark in the transfer market to counter an expected bid of over £180m from Real Madrid for Neymar.", "Barca are also wary of the possibility that Pogba's availability is being pushed to help his demands for an improved contract at Old Trafford.", 'For that reason, among others, Real Madrid have so far stayed out of the Pogba situation.', "The club's president Florentino Perez has always shied away from taking players from Mino Raiola.", "When they signed James Rodriguez in 2014, Raiola said: 'Madrid is a club that buys a player just because he plays six games well in the World Cup.'", "He was also quoted in L'Equipe as saying: 'Madrid buy players the way some people buy bath towels and then throw aside.", "We are not interested in a club like that.'", 'While Perez remains Real Madrid president, business with the Spanish giants is difficult.', 'That leaves the field clear for Barcelona, but they simply do not have the funds to match Manchester United unless they sell Dembele.']

articles: Rio Ferdinand believes Manchester City teenager Phil Foden is the ball-playing central midfielder England have been crying out for. Foden, 18, added to his growing reputation with an excellent performance in the 2-0 victory over Chelsea in Sunday's Community Shield. Ferdinand was at Wembley to watch the City wonderkid's performance and is now in no doubt that Foden can have a successful career with the national team. 'His decision making seems very good and he seems very mature for an 18-year-old in the way that he plays,' said the former England captain. 'He is the sort of player England are missing and Gareth Southgate will be hoping he gets more game time so it is easier to select him. He really is the type of player England need. 'You can see his maturity in the way he plays and the confidence that the senior players have in him. You can see it when they give him the ball. He is a player cut from a different cloth.'

articles: With less than 48 hours to go before the  transfer window slams shut, Jose Mourinho did his best to take his mind off Manchester United's incomings and outgoings by going for a bite to eat with friends. The stern-faced United boss was seen out and about in Manchester city centre on Tuesday evening, casually wearing his jumper around his neck before heading for some food with his entourage.  The 55-year-old enjoyed a night of Spanish food and wine but couldn't have been blamed if his mind was elsewhere as may have been wondering who United will be bringing in before 5pm on Thursday. Mourinho may also be fretting over the future of Paul Pogba, after the Frenchman told team-mates he's ready to leave for Barcelona. Sportsmail understands that Pogba has made it known to players and staff in the last 48 hours that he wants to be sold, two years after rejoining United from Juventus in a then world record £89million deal. The 25-year-old France midfielder is also understood to have sent a text message to Ed Woodward, informing United’s executive vice-chairman of his desire to go, although the club flatly deny this. United maintain that Pogba is not for sale, just two days before Jose Mourinho’s side kick off the season at home to Leicester. They would have little chance of signing a replacement before the transfer window closes in England at 5pm on Thursday.  Former United defender Rio Ferdinand, meanwhile, fears Mourinho's summer sulk will destabilise Manchester United's season. 'There's too much negativity coming out of Manchester United at the moment,' said Ferdinand, who played for United from 2002 to 2014, winning six Premier Leaguetitles and the Champions League in 2008. 'When you are part of a squad and you hear a lot of negativity and no positive sounds coming out of the person that is running your club — sitting on the outside it doesn't bode well.'  He has moaned about what he believes is a lack of depth in his squad as well as the apparent failure of the club — namely  Woodward — to sign players he wants. To add salt to his wounds, United target Jerome Boateng has told United that he does not wish to join them after being linked with a move to Old Trafford. United have also been linked with moves for Barcelona's Yerry Mina and Tottenham's Toby Alderweireld but both club's value the two defenders highly.

articles: Olympic champion Jack Laugher completed a golden diving double for Great Britain at the European Championships in Edinburgh on Tuesday. Laugher came from behind to clinch the men's 1m springboard title after teenagers Lois Toulson and Eden Cheng had claimed a surprise victory in the women's 10m synchro. Toulson, 18, and Cheng, 15, pulled off a superb final dive to move up from third place and eclipse Russia's Ekaterina Beliaeva and Yulia Timoshinina who had to settle for silver. It was a stunning performance from the pair who were teaming up together for only the second time at an event which also marked Londoner Cheng's senior Great Britain debut. 'It's amazing,' said Cheng, who took up the sport after being inspired during London 2012. 'Just to think that last year I did my first senior international for Great Britain, and now I'm standing here at the senior Europeans.' Home city hero Duncan Scott defied a difficult lane draw to claim an improbable 200 metres freestyle gold medal in Glasgow. The 21-year-old continued his emergence as one of the hottest prospects for Tokyo 2020 on a night when Freya Anderson also led Great Britain's women's 200m freestyle relay team to the top of the podium. Qualifying only eighth fastest, Scott, 21, was given a difficult task in the outside lane but won with a storming finish. Scott said: 'I didn't really know what was going on with the rest of the field so it was quite tough.' Meanwhile, 17-year-old Anderson dug deep as she steered home the women's 200m freestyle relay team. Eleanor Faulkner, Kathryn Greenslade and Holly Hibbott had put Anderson in position to fight for a medal but gold looked in doubt until the teenager's explosive final leg. In track cycling, Britain's Matthew Walls, 20, won gold in the men's elimination race by beating Portugal's Rui Oliveira in the final sprint to win Team GB's' fourth gold medal, a disappointment by their high standards. Britain's tally of four golds, three silvers and three bronzes put them second in the track cycling medal table behind the Netherlands.

articles: The USPGA Championship is only two days away and is being broadcast on Eleven Sports for the first time – but there is still no advertising of golf's fourth major on their website home page, or clear instructions on how to watch it. Eleven Sports, an online streaming service founded and controlled by Leeds United owner Andrea Radrizzani, snapped up the TV rights for the USPGA after Sky Sports again balked at the price quoted and the BBC decided against a repeat of their poorly-received, last-minute broadcast last year. Yet there is no mention whatsoever of the USPGA on the elevensports.com home page as of the time of publication, while the products advertised there include the Singapore Premier League, the NBA's minor league and the Lamigo Monkeys Chinese baseball team in Taiwan.   Google searches for 'Eleven Sports Golf', 'Eleven Sports USPGA', 'Watch USPGA on Eleven Sports', 'Watch PGA Championship on Eleven Sports' and many other variants of the key search words produce zero web pages published by the broadcaster, either explaining how to watch their coverage or even promoting their involvement in the big week ahead. Only when searching through the 'news' section of the Eleven Sports home page can a single mention of the USPGA be found, simply directing potential customers to visit the home page – where there is no mention of the golf. The UK version of the website contains prominent advertising for the USPGA Championship - but a Google search for 'Eleven Sports' does not produce a result for the UK website, which is sure to leave many golf fans clueless on how to access it.     Tiger Woods, Rory McIlroy and Open champion Francesco Molinari will be among those hoping to dethrone last year's winner Justin Thomas at Bellerive Country Club in Missouri. Dustin Johnson is the bookies' favourite to win the last USPGA to be held in August before it shifts to a May date from next year. Eleven Sports currently holds no other TV rights for golf but will broadcast both La Liga and Serie A football in the new season. They will charge customers £5.99 a month for the channel or an annual pass of £49.99, if paid by August 31. From that date the price will rise by £10. The good news for golf fans is that the USPGA will be broadcast for free, as Eleven Sports are offering customers a free seven-day trial monthly pass. The first two rounds will also be streamed for free on Facebook Live through the Eleven Sports UK page. Sports fans will be able to watch coverage on their website or their app (for both iOS and Android). Sportsmail has contacted Eleven Sports for comment.

articles: Jonny May drew comparisons with Usain Bolt last season, but England's speed king reckons he can get even quicker. The Leicester and England wing clocked a 40-metre sprint speed of 10.49 metres per second last November during an England training session: a time to rival that of the Jamaican sprint sensation. May was one of England's top performers during a challenging tour of South Africa in the summer, showcasing his pace in all three Tests which included a stunning finish for the match-winning try in the Cape Town finale. 'I was happy with how I played but what you see at the weekend is the product of a plan,' May said. 'I want to get smarter and faster and that's the product of years of working. 'You spend your whole career working. I feel that over time I've gradually been getting better and played the best rugby I've ever played out in South Africa and running fast as well.' May, who has scored 17 tries in 37 appearances for his country, was part of England's pre-season training camp last week and is set to play an integral role in the forthcoming autumn internationals with Tests against South Africa, New Zealand, Japan and Australia. The 28-year-old spent two weeks working on his speed at the performance centre run by sprinter and Olympic champion Michael Johnson in Texas last month. May trained at the facility after he suffered a cruciate ligament injury at the end of 2015 and returned to sharpen his sprinting ahead of the new season. There he met Olympic sprinter English Gardner who recovered from a serious knee injury to reach the 2016 Olympics and help the US women's 4x100m relay team win gold in Rio. 'It was awesome for me to meet her because when I did my knee two years ago, the surgeon said it was touch and go whether I'd come back at the same speed,' he explained. 'People say you lose five per cent (of your speed) after an ACL injury. I was trawling though the internet to find people who have had the same injury. 'English Gardner blew her knee out just before she went to college. She had all her scholarships taken away and then within 13 months ran the record and now she's one of the fastest women in the world. She definitely inspired me.'

articles: Over a 23-year professional career there is little in the golf world Tiger Woods has not seen or courses he has not played. But this week will provide a rare new experience for the 42-year-old as he prepares for the 100th PGA Championship and his first competitive round at a steamy Bellerive Country Club. Named for Louis St. Ange De Bellerive, the last French Governor in North America, the club was founded in 1897 and they have been playing the Green Monster of Ladue at its current location since 1960. A visit to Bellerive does not trigger happy memories for Woods, though, with injury and tragedy having conspired to keep him from challenging the leafy parkland course. In 2008 when Bellerive hosted the BMW Championship Woods was dealing with knee injuries and in 2001 the World Golf Championship was cancelled due to the events of 9/11, Woods recalling how a contemplative 17-hour drive home to Florida changed his outlook on the sport and life. 'I literally haven't set foot on this golf course since that week in 2001,' said Woods, following a rain interrupted practice round on Tuesday. 'Didn't get up here pre-British Open, and yesterday I took the day off. 'So today we only got in five holes and didn't really get a chance to see a whole lot. 'I'll have to do some more homework tomorrow and get a good feel for what's going on for the rest of the week. 'I was recovering from a surgery in 2008 and we all know what happened in 2001.' With 79 career PGA Tour wins and 12 international victories, Woods has shown that he possesses the ability and skill to win on all manner of courses and in any conditions. But a closer look at his haul indicates the former world number one has his happy hunting grounds with nearly half of his PGA titles plundered from five courses. He has eight WGC victories at Akron's Firestone Country Club, eight from the Arnold Palmer Invitational at Bay Hill in Orlando, seven at Torrey Pines, five Memorial titles at Muirfield Village and four Green Jackets from Augusta National. While familiarity can breed success Woods insists that this week form and conditions will be more important than experience. Seeking a record-equalling fifth PGA Championship and his first major since 2008, Woods arrives in St. Louis fit and confident after an outstanding run at the British Open title three weeks ago where he finished in a tie for sixth spot. 'Right now it doesn't really favor anyone because it's playing so soft,' said Woods. 'If anything, it favours a guy who hits the ball high because we're not going to get any run, it's not going to dry out the rest of the week. 'It's going to be hot, it's going to be wet and, fortunately, I'm one of the guys who hits the ball high and gets the ball up in the air, and you just need to get the ball out there.'

articles: Burnley are likely to sell one of their goalkeepers within six months, after the £3.5million acquisition of Joe Hart from Manchester City left them with no fewer than three who have played for England in the last three seasons. Tom Heaton, who was replaced by Nick Pope last season when a dislocated shoulder kept him out from September to May, seems the more likely to leave, with manager Sean Dyche resigned to the fact that neither would be happy as a long-term reserve. But the wealth of options could make Burnley receptive to a major offer for Pope, whose form last season puts him marginally ahead of Heaton. Pope, who has also now dislocated a shoulder, could be out for as long as Heaton was last season. Dyche has been reluctant to provide any sense of how serious the injury is or how long the 26-year-old is likely to be out. Heaton is also currently out with a calf injury. Hart, who will wear to No 20 jersey after a move which ends his 12-year association with City, is likely to become a back-up option when Heaton returns. But Hart's desperate need to leave City — where Pep Guardiola rapidly consigned him to the wilderness in 2016 — still makes Turf Moor appealing. City have paid up Hart's contract, allowing him to start again on a salary far below the level he has become accustomed to.  Dyche is the highest paid individual at Burnley, on £70,000 a week, and Hart, 31, is likely to command something closer to £50,000 a week. He arrives on a two-year deal, with the added advantage of being able to commute from Manchester. 'City need to go on and do their thing and I need to do mine,' said Hart, who hopes to draw a line under a wretched two years, including a difficult last season at West Ham.  'To be part of a team where everyone is pushing in the same direction is not as normal as you would expect it to be.'

articles: Raheem Sterling has paid tribute to Joe Hart following his move to Burnley... but the goalkeeper may not be best pleased with his former team-mate. Hart joined Burnley for £3.5million on a two-year cotnract on Tuesday after spending a successful 12 years at Manchester City. Sterling, who has played with Hart at international level, became City team-mates with him when he joined from fellow Premier League outfit Liverpool in 2015. And following Hart's transfer to Burnley, Sterling praised the England goalkeeper for his services to City, describing him as a 'true legend'. However, Sterling had to have the last laugh, posting a humorous throwback picture of Hart from his early days within football. On Instagram, England's World Cup semi-finalist said: 'Just want to wish, one of the most down to earth genuine guys I’ve ever met all the very best on his new chapter.  'I will never forget my first few weeks at City. You helped me settle into a new environment, went out his way to make me feel at home, not to forget the history you have created with @mancity. 'Wishing you the very best and all the success in the future!!!! @joehartofficial #TRUELEGEND'. His words of appreciation for his compatriot were accompanied by two photos, a recent one of him alongside Vincent Kompany and David Silva, while the other is of a fresh-faced Hart from when he was younger. Sterling wasn't the only City player to pay tribute to Hart. Kompany also took to his Instagram account to acknowledge his great services. The City skipper said: 'Joe joined as a young lad from Shrewsbury and leaves as a City legend. When you look at the club he joined and the club as it is now, we have come so far during his time in Manchester and Joe has been a huge part of that.  'Those saves against Dortmund and Barcelona, that hug with Gael (Clichy) in 2012, these are moments we won’t ever forget.  'It’s been an absolute pleasure to play alongside a friend and a true leader for so many years and I know I speak on behalf of every City fan when I say I hope he means as much to his next club as he has meant to us.'

£3.5million on a two-year cotnract on Tuesday after spending a successful 12 years at Manchester City.', 'Sterling, who has played with Hart at international level, became City team-mates with him when he joined from fellow Premier League outfit Liverpool in 2015.', "And following Hart's transfer to Burnley, Sterling praised the England goalkeeper for his services to City, describing him as a 'true legend'.", 'However, Sterling had to have the last laugh, posting a humorous throwback picture of Hart from his early days within football.', "On Instagram, England's World Cup semi-finalist said: 'Just want to wish, one of the most down to earth genuine guys I’ve ever met all the very best on his new chapter.", "'I will never forget my first few weeks at City.", 'You helped me settle into a new environment, went out his way to make me feel at home, not to forget the history you have created with @mancity.', "'Wishing you the very best and all the success in the future!!!!", "@joehartofficial #TRUELEGEND'.", 'His words of appreciation for his compatriot were accompanied by two photos, a recent one of him alongside Vincent Kompany and David Silva, while the other is of a articles: Sean Dyche continued his last minute recruitment drive on Tuesday night by snapping up Derby County goalscorer Matej Vydra for £11million. Fresh from completing the £3.5m transfer of Joe Hart from Manchester City, the Burnley manager accelerated the move for Derby's Vydra with a deal that is expected to see Nahki Wells move the other way on an initial loan. Vydra, who scored 22 goals last season and saw an £11m move to Leeds United fall through last week, underwent a medical on Tuesday ahead of agreeing a three-year contract with the option of a further 12 months. 'For the last four years I have been fighting to be in the Premier League.' Vydra told Burnley's official website. 'I haven't done it with the teams I was playing for and sometimes it has to be done with a transfer and now I'm so happy. 'My ambition is to play in the best league in the world so thank-you to the gaffer here and to Burnley for giving me a hand to play in the Premier League and now it's about me to show he chose the right person.' Dyche had been expected to return to West Brom with an improved bid for Jay Rodriguez but has held off so far. However, not content there, Dyche has also discussed a potential £15m deal for Everton's Yannick Bolasie but the Congo international's £70,000-a-week wages could yet prove the stumbling block.  Crystal Palace and Middlesbrough have also asked about the 29-year-old. Middlesbrough hold an interest in Burnley striker Sam Vokes but face competition from a number of Championship clubs.

articles: Chelsea are discussing a loan deal for Real Madrid midfielder Mateo Kovacic. Sportsmail revealed Chelsea's interest last week as they sought an alternative to Aaron Ramsey. Though Croatia international Kovacic trained with Real Madrid on Monday he has told them he wants to leave for regular football and has grown frustrated by their refusal to listen to offers. Madrid remain in contact with Chelsea over goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois and the Belgian is expected to move to Spain once Chelsea have a replacement. Kovacic is valued at £60m and has been discussed by Manchester City also this summer. He confirmed his desire to change clubs during the World Cup and has asked the club to leave on three occasions. Maurizio Sarri has already added midfielder Jorginho and Rob Green as back-up keeper.

articles: Kieran Trippier's stunning World Cup for England has put Europe's elite on alert. The Tottenham Hotspur right back played a starring role in the Three Lions' faith-restoring tournament, creating chances and scoring a free-kick that put Gareth Southgate's men ahead in the semi-final. Sportsmail understands a number of top clubs on the continent - including Paris Saint-Germain, Juventus and Real Madrid - are now tracking the Bury born 27-year-old. Manchester United are also looking at successors to 33-year-old Antonio Valencia, and have long admired City youth product Trippier, although any move from the Old Trafford giants may come in 12 months' time. Spurs chairman Daniel Levy tied down a number of stars, including Golden Boot winner Harry Kane, in a series of shrewd moves before the tournament. Trippier penned a new deal last summer and his value will have rocketed since.  PSG have lost Brazil right back Dani Alves to injury and are thought to be looking for a replacement, while Juventus are keen on finding support for high-profile arrival of Cristiano Ronaldo. Real Madrid are also seeking a right back and the fact that the European window does not close until the end of the month may keep Spurs on tenterhooks. Tottenham are yet to make a signing in this window, which shuts on Thursday, and will be reluctant to lose a player of Trippier's calibre.

articles: Gary Neville lost a penalty shoot-out bet with Jamie Carragher and must wear a Liverpool shirt with 'Shaqiri 23' on the back as a result.  The Sky Sports pundits went head-to-head from 12 yards on the 'Premier League Launch Show' on Tuesday. Carragher resumed his role as a football pundit for Sky Sports after his suspension for spitting at a car was lifted by the broadcaster. Before stepping up to take the spot-kick with his colleague in goal, Neville asked: 'What's the bet by the way? There's got to be something on this.' Carragher replied: 'Get you a better shirt.' Neville said: 'You've got to wear a United shirt or I've got to wear a Liverpool shirt when you've felt your way back in in a show in a few weeks.' Carragher guessed correctly, saving Neville's right-footed effort towards the right-hand side of the goal with his body.  As Neville held his head in his hands, Carragher said: 'Please score this please, has anyone got a Liverpool shirt now?'  The former Liverpool defender then stepped up to seal the win by sending the ex-United defender the wrong way. Carragher turned to the camera and said: 'That's a Liverpool shirt, I'll buy it.  '23 Carragher on the back. No I'll tell you what we'll get 23 Shaqiri on the back. 'He hates Shaqiri doesn't he? You've been very nasty about Shaqiri.' Neville responded: 'I like Shaqiri, I didn't like his comments against Stoke but I like him.' Carragher responded: 'OK, I'll get him to get you a signed shirt.'  Neville called Switzerland international Xherdan Shaqiri 'unprofessional' and admitted he was not a fan of the winger during the World Cup. He also hit back at Liverpool fans who mocked his criticism of Shaqiri with: 'I hope you lot are going to message me every time you see him stood on the halfway line whilst your team are being attacked! Oh and he needs Ronaldinho playing with him.'

articles: Romelu Lukaku appears delighted to be back at Manchester United following his impressive campaign at the World Cup with Belgium. Lukaku, who returned to United training on Monday after enjoying his holidays following his exertions in Russia, is currently gearing up for the upcoming Premier League season. And he has been hard at work at United's Carrington training base alongside his team-mates, especially Nemanja Matic and Alexis Sanchez. The Belgium international uploaded a video onto his Instagram story of Matic getting his body fat measured while the latter wore nothing but pants and sunglasses. And the striker can amusingly be heard shouting down the camera: 'Damn boy, zero per cent fat... zero!' Meanwhile, Lukaku is also continuing to grow his already strong friendship with Chile star Sanchez off the pitch.  25-year-old Lukaku filmed his 'friend' Sanchez working out in the gym, while jokingly using an endearing Instagram filter.  Jose Mourinho's side begin their Premier League campaign against Leicester on Friday night after enduring a difficult pre-season. The Red Devils only won one of their pre-season matches in normal time - against Real Madrid - and will be thankful to have Lukaku and the rest of their World Cup stars back training.

articles: Watford have made a £10million offer for Southampton midfielder James Ward-Prowse. It is understood that the Hornets would like to bolster their midfield ahead of the new Premier League season.  The 23-year-old has been with Southampton all of his career after coming through the club's youth system. Saints would need to act quickly to add cover if Ward-Prowse does leave. Mark Hughes is looking to sell players as he tries to raise money to be competitive in the transfer market. Saints host Burnley on Sunday in their first match of this season's Premier League.

articles: Rangers were weighing up a £1.2million bid from Ipswich Town for Josh Windass on Tuesday night. The Championship club are seeking a replacement for Derby-bound £5m man Martyn Waghorn. And Windass, who scored 18 goals for Rangers in all competitions last season, is the man they want before Thursday night’s English transfer deadline. Windass signed a contract extension as recently as February. Linked last night with a move for Dinamo Zagreb striker Armin Hodzic, Rangers are seeking a hefty sell-on clause before agreeing to sell the former Accrington Stanley attacker. In another development, it was claimed by the president of Bosnian outfit Krupa that the Ibrox club have made a bid for striker Elvir Koljic, who has hit five goals in the first three games of the new season.  ‘We have had offers from four clubs, Rangers, Panathinaikos, Red Star in France and Waasland-Beveren,’ said Drasko Ilic. ‘We are waiting for the right price.’ Meanwhile, Borna Barisic has set his sights on becoming a permanent fixture for World Cup finalists Croatia after Steven Gerrard made him his 11th new recruit at Rangers. The £2m left-back impressed in his role as captain of Osijek despite his team’s elimination from the Europa League by the Ibrox men. The 25-year-old, who scored with a deflected strike in the second leg in Govan, penned a four-year deal with Gerrard’s side on Tuesday. Barisic, who has three caps for his country, made Croatia’s preliminary squad for the World Cup but did not make boss Zlatko Dalic’s final cut. However, he believes moving to Glasgow, where he will team up with fellow Croatian defender Nikola Katic, will boost his international ambitions. ‘This club will give me a chance to play for the national team again,’ said Barisic. ‘Nikola Katic is my friend. I have played with him once in the Croatian national team and he is a great player and guy. I’m really excited to play with him again. ‘I’m very excited to be part of Rangers. It’s such a big family and a club with the most trophies in the world.’ Barisic admitted he was blown away by the ‘crazy’ atmosphere at Ibrox when a 1-1 draw gave Rangers a 2-1 aggregate win and set up a third-round qualifier against Maribor, who they play at home in the first leg on Thursday. Barisic, who is not eligible for the qualifying rounds of the Europa League, will provide competition for Jon Flanagan at left back. That has pushed Declan John down the pecking order, with the Welshman believed to be a target for Swansea City, while Rangers remain keen to seal a loan deal for Bournemouth centre back Jake Simpson. Meanwhile, Greg Docherty is set to join Shrewsbury Town on a season-long loan deal.

articles: Tottenham are set to let Victor Wanyama leave to join Serie A side Roma - despite failing to secure any new signings in the transfer window yet. Mauricio Pochettino is desperate to get some new faces in before Thursday evening's deadline, but it looks like there will be another exit before any arrivals. According to Italian newspaper La Repubblica, Roma had hoped to sign Steven N'Zonzi over the summer but they have so far been unsuccessful. Games played:  23  Mins: 839  Goals scored: 1 Assists: 0  Pass Success: 87.2%  They are now reportedly turning their attentions to Wanyama, who only started eight Premier League games for Pochettino's Spurs last season. N'Zonzi, meanwhile, could yet leave Sevilla but he is understood to be keen on a return to the Premier League over a move to Italy. Arsenal and Everton have both been linked with the former Stoke City man, but time is running out before the window shuts for English teams on Thursday. Wanyama is not a regular starter for Tottenham, despite making 23 competitive appearances last season. He came on as a substitute in 11 of those, only starting eight league games and four FA Cup ties. The Kenyan is also currently sidelined with a knee injury, and he missed four months of last season through various ailments. He first injured his knee last August, before a thigh problem in May and another knee issue last month.

articles: Chelsea are set to hit Thibaut Courtois with a £200,000 fine after the Belgian failed to return to pre-season training this week. After reaching the final weekend of the World Cup with Belgium, Courtois was due to return to Cobham on Monday but failed to turn up in a desperate bid to force a move away from Stamford Bridge. The fine consists of two weeks' wages for the goalkeeper, who is thought to be on a £100,000-per-week deal. The Blues have opened disciplinary procedures against Courtois who remains in Belgium having also failed to turn up on Tuesday morning. Courtois is hoping to force through a move to Real Madrid but Chelsea will not let the keeper leave for less than £45million. However, the 26-year-old has just 12-months to run on his current deal and Chelsea may have to compromise on a fee or face the risk of losing a prized asset on a free transfer next summer. Maurizio Sarri will also be keen to have a replacement lined up before Thursday's 5pm deadline.  Jan Oblak has been targeted as a replacement, with the Blues even tempted to break the world record fee for a goalkeeper by triggering the Atletico Madrid stopper's £89million release clause. Courtois holds a desire to return to his family in Madrid, where he featured before replacing Petr Cech as No 1 at Stamford Bridge. He spent three seasons on loan at Atletico after joining Chelsea back in 2011, impressing as the club won La Liga and the Europa League, before finishing runners-up in the Champions League in 2014.

articles: Manchester United have 'tabled a final bid of £40million for Tottenham defender Toby Alderweireld' as they seek to bolster their defence before the transfer window closes on Thursday. Jose Mourinho has made it clear to the Old Trafford hierarchy that a new central defender is a priority but United appear no closer to landing any of their targets. According to the Mirror, they will offer Tottenham £40m for the Belgian in a take it or leave it offer that still falls some way short of the London club's valuation of £55m. Mourinho has instructed the club to explore other possibilities if Tottenham don't want to sell Alderweireld, with an enquiry made for Bayern Munich defender Jerome Boateng, who could cost around £45m. But Alderweireld remains the No 1 target for United though Spurs want at least £50m for a player who has just nine months remaining on his contract. Spurs do have an option to extend Alderweireld's contract by another 12 months, but that would automatically trigger a clause which allows him to leave for £25m. United were keen on £65m-rated Leicester City and England centre half Harry Maguire following his impressive World Cup, but the Foxes have told them he is not for sale at any price. Mourinho's side host Leicester in their opening Premier League fixture on Friday evening.
MsgSentenceTokens: ["Manchester United have 'tabled a final bid of £40million for Tottenham defender Toby Alderweireld' as they seek to bolster their defence before the transfer window closes on Thursday.", 'Jose Mourinho has made it clear to the Old Trafford hierarchy that a new central defender is a priority but United appear no closer to landing any of their targets.', "According to the Mirror, they will offer Tottenham £40m for the Belgian in a take it or leave it offer that still falls some way short of the London club's valuation of £55m.", "Mourinho has instructed the club to explore other possibilities if Tottenham don't want to sell Alderweireld, with an enquiry made for Bayern Munich defender Jerome Boateng, who could cost around £45m.", 'But Alderweireld remains the No 1 target for United though Spurs want at least £50m for a player who has just nine months remaining on his contract.', "Spurs do have an option to extend Alderweireld's contract by another 12 months, but that would automatically trigger a clause which allows him to leave for £25m.", 'United were keen on £65m-rated Leicester City and England centre half Harry Maguire following his impressive World Cup, but the Foxes have told them he is not for sale at any price.', "Mourinho's side host Leicester in their opening Premier League fixture on Friday evening."]

articles: With 48 hours left of the transfer window and the new campaign closing in, managers are getting twitchy as they look to wrap up those last-minute signings. Teams at both ends of the league are targeting additions but with so little time left to begin negotiations with clubs and players, it remains to be seen who will be left frustrated at missing out on a key target.   Sportsmail looks at 10 potential deals that could be completed before the window closes for Premier League clubs on Thursday.  THIBAUT COURTOIS (Chelsea to Real Madrid, £40m)  With the hours now ticking down to the deadline, Courtois is doing all he can to secure the move away. Having gone AWOL from training on Monday - in a bid to avoid a conversation with new boss Maurizio Sarri - Courtois has shown he himself sees no future at Stamford Bridge.  With just 12 months left on his contract, there is an urgency for Chelsea to find a resolution rather than lose him for nothing next summer.  The key issue for the club is that if they do decide to sanction a move to Real Madrid, they would be left exposed without a world-class replacement; Atletico Madird's Jan Oblak has also been mooted given his £89m release clause.  KEPA ARRIZABALAGA (Athletic Bilbao to Chelsea, £72m) Chelsea have been linked with a move for both Jack Butland and Leicester goalkeeper Kasper Schmeichel but new boss Maurizio Sarri has seemingly turned to La Liga to replace Courtois. The two teams have agreed a £72m deal for for the 23-year-old, who is set to arrive in London on Wednesday. Kepa has made one appearance for the Spanish national team, who of course have Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea as their current No 1.    But after only 54 appearances for Bilbao, Kepa has impressed Chelsea enough to persuade them to match his lofty release clause.  LUCAS PEREZ (Arsenal to West Ham, £7m) The 29-year-old forward lost his way since joining Arsenal two years ago and is desperately seeking a new start elsewhere in the Premier League. It initially appeared he had a future at the Emirates Stadium under new boss Unai Emery having been part of the club's pre-season tour in Singapore, but now it transpires he is set for an exit before the deadline. West Ham have already spent big this summer, landing the likes of Felipe Anderson, Issa Diop and Andriy Yarmolenko - as well as bringing in former Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere on a free transfer.  MATEO KOVACIC (Real Madrid to Chelsea, £50m)  Failing to turn up to training is becoming a habit for a number of wantaway stars right before the window for Premier League clubs closes on Thursday. New Madrid boss Julen Lopetegui has denied that Kovacic skipped training but the signs are pointing towards an exit for the unhappy midfielder. He has already rejected a move to Manchester United over fears of playing under Jose Mourinho but Chelsea is a viable destination between now and Thursday. Aaron Ramsey has also been linked with the Blues as boss Sarri looks to bolster his creativity in central midfield in the wake of Sunday's Community Shield defeat. Allowing Courtois the move could prove a sweetener in any Kovacic deal.   ALVARO NEGREDO (Besiktas to Cardiff, £3m) Cardiff are the odds-on side to be relegated from the Premier League and boss Neil Warnock is desperately seeking striking reinforcements before the deadline. Negredo would prove a cheap addition and having previously had top-flight experience with Manchester City and Middlesbrough, would provide some nous among his team-mates.  The 32-year-old scored nine goals in 32 appearances at the Etihad Stadium and managed a further nine goals in 36 games for Boro.  Expect the Welsh side to bolster between now and the deadline.   JACK GREALISH (Aston Villa to Tottenham, £20m) If Tottenham are to make any signing happen between now and Thursday, it will be the acquisition of Grealish. The young Englishman was in action for Aston Villa on Monday night and impressed in the 2-1 win over Hull. Spurs are yet to make a signing so far this summer and with fans anxious over their rivals' business, it is likely the club will eye at least one new face. Villa boss Steve Bruce, resigned almost to the departure, accepted Grealish wants to climb the ladder:  'He is a wonderful talent,' Bruce told Sky Sports. 'We will do our best to keep hold of him, but it is going to be difficult. 'We understand the human side. He will want to play in the Premier League, Europe, Champions League.'  JEROME BOATENG (Bayern Munich to Manchester United, £40m) All we have heard this summer is that United boss Jose Mourinho wants at least two new faces before the window closes. A central defender has been top of his wishlist with the likes of Toby Alderweireld, Harry Maguire and Barcelona's Yerry Mina all on the radar. Defensively it appears the club need to sell before they can buy and that is what has been holding up moves for any of the stars on the shortlist. But former Manchester City defender Boateng appears to be the most attainable with Mina now edging closer to Everton.  Boateng, as revealed by Sportsmail last week, was offered to United after a move to Paris Saint-Germain fell through. One to keep an eye on between now and Thursday's deadline.   OUSMANE DEMBELE (Barcelona to Manchester United or Arsenal, £100m) With Anthony Martial ostracised under Mourinho at Old Trafford, the Portuguese is crying out for a versatile forward to be brought in as a replacement. Martial's French compatriot Dembele has a number of admiring glances from across Europe and may look for a fresh challenge following the arrival of Malcom at the Nou Camp. Hampered by injury for large spells of last season, the former Borussia Dortmund star may decide he has to right a few wrongs this time round and after such a significant outlay to get him, it is unlikely he would come cheap. Given the scale of the deal and the figures involved, both club and player need to accelerate in a bid to get it done.  Arsenal could yet push for a loan deal, with Dembele close friends with many of their stars, including Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and Henrikh Mkhitaryan.    MARCOS ROJO (Manchester United to Everton, £30m) Much like United, Everton are also a side that are keen to add defensive options before the window closes and Rojo is the first-choice option.  Mina appears a more likely arrival given Rojo's desire to remain at Old Trafford but news he could struggle to get any game-time may sway his thinking in the next 48 hours. The Reds need a departure or they risk housing an expensive asset until January at least, until the winter window commences.   NABIL FEKIR (Lyon to Liverpool or Chelsea, £60m)  Left out of Lyon's side to face Chelsea on Tuesday, the wheels appear to be in motion that Fekir could finally leave the French club. He came mightily close to the exit door when he was a few details away from joining Liverpool earlier this summer but the deal eventually collapsed. Chelsea remain interested in the World Cup winner but with Liverpool so keen to push Manchetser City all the way for the title, do not rule out a late swoop from Jurgen Klopp, even after their lavish summer outlay.

articles: Usain Bolt's dream of becoming a professional footballer has moved a step closer after earning an 'indefinite' trial at Central Coast Mariners. The eight-time Olympic champion has expressed his desire to move into football following his retirement from athletics and will train with the A-League side to try and earn a contract. The 31-year-old has already trained with several clubs around the world, including Borussia Dortmund, Stromgodset and Mamelodi Sundowns, but his stint in Australia looks to be his best chance of winning a deal. He said on Central Coast Mariners' official website: 'I am very excited about coming to Australia and would like to thank the owner and management of the Central Coast Mariners for giving me this opportunity. 'It has been my dream to play professional football and I know that it will involve a lot of hard work and training to get to the level required to play and make an impact in the A-League. 'When I spoke to the head coach Mike Mulvey on the phone he outlined the ambitions of the club and his plans for the upcoming season. 'I hope I can make a positive contribution to the club and look forward to meeting the other players, staff and fans in the coming weeks. 'I always say that, "Anything is possible, don't think limits", and I look forward to the challenge.' The Mariners have insisted that the extended trial is not a commitment to a contract, but want to give the Jamaican a chance. They said in a statement: 'The Central Coast Mariners can today confirm that Usain Bolt has committed to an indefinite training period with the club, with the aim to develop the 'world's fastest man' into a professional footballer. 'The agreement between the Central Coast Mariners and Usain Bolt does not guarantee a professional playing contract but does provide the eight-time Olympic gold medallist with an opportunity to achieve his burning desire to play football professionally.' Chief executive Shaun Mielekamp added: 'Our goal is to be the most innovative, entertaining and community minded sports brand in Australia, this is our competitive edge. 'Having Usain Bolt come to the club to train and hopefully develop into a professional football player is perfectly aligned to this part of the club's philosophy. 'It is important that we don't get too caught up in the hype of possibilities, but the reality is that Usain Bolt has placed his faith in the Central Coast Mariners to accelerate his football journey. 'Whilst we all know this must be tempered with the reality that there is a job to do and hard work ahead, we are committed to building a team that will win matches and instil belief, hopefully Usain can help us on this mission.' The Mariners begin their A-League campaign in October.

articles: Jay Rodriguez has pleaded with West Bromwich to let him join Burnley ahead of Thursday's transfer deadline. The Baggies have rejected a couple of offers from the Clarets, who want Rodriguez to return to the club ahead of the new Premier League season. And Sportsmail understands Rodriguez has now spoken to manager Darren Moore to express his wish to leave the Hawthorns for a return to Lancashire. The West Brom board have also been informed of the player's ambition to leave for Burnley in the next 48 hours. The forward has so far stopped short of handing in an official transfer request. The 29-year-old has remained professional throughout the summer despite his desire to join Burnley and started in the weekend defeat by Bolton. But Rodriguez hopes his latest move will be enough for West Brom to change their stance ahead of the transfer deadline.
MsgSentenceTokens: ["Jay Rodriguez has pleaded with West Bromwich to let him join Burnley ahead of Thursday's transfer deadline.", 'The Baggies have rejected a couple of offers from the Clarets, who want Rodriguez to return to the club ahead of the new Premier League season.', 'And Sportsmail understands Rodriguez has now spoken to manager Darren Moore to express his wish to leave the Hawthorns for a return to Lancashire.', "The West Brom board have also been informed of the player's ambition to leave for Burnley in the next 48 hours.", 'The forward has so far stopped short of handing in an official transfer request.', 'The 29-year-old has remained professional throughout the summer despite his desire to join Burnley and started in the weekend defeat by Bolton.', 'But Rodriguez hopes his latest move will be enough for West Brom to change their stance ahead of the transfer deadline.']

articles: Manchester United are ready to enter the race to sign Ousmane Dembele before the Thursday's transfer deadline as boss Jose Mourinho demands new faces ahead of the campaign.  The club have added Lee Grant, Diogo Dalot and Fred already this summer but a central defender and another flair player are high on Mourinho's wishlist.  According to Mundo Deportivo, Mourinho has eyed Dembele, who also fuelled talk of a move to Arsenal having posed with the club's big stars recently, having seen his relationship with Anthony Martial sour.   Appearances: 33  Minutes: 1097  Goals: 5  Assists: 6  The 21-year-old has struggled badly with injuries since leaving Borussia Dortmund for Barcelona and after the arrival of Malcom this summer, he may angle for a new start in England. Mourinho has long said he wishes for two more players  with stars such as Harry Maguire, Toby Alderweireld and Sergej Milinkovic-Savic all linked twith an Old Trafford switch. But with little movement during the club's disappointing pre-season tour of America, the Portuguese's relationship with executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward is said to have become strained. An awkward exchange in the tunnel after the friendly against Real Madrid demonstrated in public for the first time how tense the pair's relationship was and no new arrivals will only likely exacerbate it from Mourinho's side.   'My CEO knows what I want for quite a long time, I know he tries to do the best for me and I still have a few days to wait to see what happens,' Mourinho said on Sunday.  'If we don't make our team better it will be a difficult season for us.' Prior to that, Mourinho's extraordinary outburst in Michigan where he questioned a number of players and exposed his undeniable anguish at the lack of new faces has cranked up the pressure with two days to go.  United host Leicester City in the opening game of the new Premier League season on Friday night but new faces remains up in the air with Jerome Boateng also on the radar following defeat by Bayern Munich.

articles: Standard Liege fought back from two goals down to draw 2-2 with Ajax Amsterdam, while Benfica edged Fenerbahce 1-0 in Champions League third qualifying round, first-leg ties on Tuesday. After going in 2-0 down at halftime, Medhi Carcela pulled one back for Liege before Renaud Emond scored a 94th minute penalty to equalise after Ajax striker Klaas-Jan Huntelaar and Dusan Tadic put the four-time Dutch European Cup winners ahead. Visitors Ajax had looked comfortable after former Southampton winger Tadic set up the first goal with a swerving cross before drilling home the second himself. Standard Liege 2-2 Ajax Benfica 1-0 Fenerbahce Slavia Prague 1-1 Dynamo Kiev Malmo 1-1 Videoton Astana 0-2 Dinamo Zagreb Qarabag 0-1 BATE Red Star Belgrade 1-1 Spartak Trnava  However Belgian side Liege clawed their way back into the game and Emond struck the woodwork before slotting home from the spot after Noussair Mazraoui fouled substitute Moussa Djenepo. The winners of the tie in Amsterdam next week will face either Slavia Prague or Dynamo Kiev in the playoff round for a place in the group stage of Europe's elite club competition. Those teams drew 1-1 in the Czech capital after Josef Jusbauer's 95th minute penalty for a dominant Slavia cancelled out Benjamin Verbic's 82nd minute opener. In Lisbon, Benfica earned a narrow victory in a match they controlled as Franco Cervi's deflected strike after 69 minutes handed them the advantage over Fenerbahce, with both teams entering in this round of the qualifying process. When the teams played in the European Cup first round in 1975 Benfica won 7-0 but this time the Turkish side can hope to stage a second-leg comeback to secure a play-off against PAOK Athens or Spartak Moscow who meet on Wednesday. Stanislav Dragun's header earned Belarusians BATE Borisov a 1-0 win at last season's Champions League group qualifers Qarabag, with the eventual winners facing PSV Eindhoven. Dinamo Zagreb won 2-0 at Astana, who reached the group stage in 2015, with goals from Mario Budimir and the impressive Dani Olmo to put one foot in the playoffs where Young Boys await. Elsewhere, Malmo drew 1-1 with Vidi and Red Star Belgrade were held by Spartak Trnava with the same scoreline.
